intro: Bidens tripartita var. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental ironweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of tiny flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes and stream banks. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with prominent white ray florets. This variant is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and adaptability to wet conditions.
